name: Spicy Thai Peanut Noodles
author: Seaottr
summary: This Thai peanut noodle dish is a delicious recipe with just the right amount of heat! It's simple to prepare, but requires a bit of organization while assembling/cooking, because it goes quickly. Preparing your ingredients beforehand is key! For vegetarians, you can make this without the chicken and fish sauce and it tastes just as good! Serve hot. You could also garnish this with chopped unsalted peanuts.
ingredients: 2  red Thai chiles, seeded and finely chopped
1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 3/4-inch cubes
1  red bell pepper, sliced into thin strips
2 cups bean sprouts, rinsed and drained
1 (16 ounce) package pad Thai rice noodles
directions: Whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, sesame oil, Thai chiles, chile-garlic sauce, ginger, fish sauce, and pepper in a bowl until smooth
Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large wok or non-stick pan over high heat
Add chicken and stir constantly until almost cooked, about 3 minutes
Pour in 1/4 cup sauce mixture to chicken
Cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 1 to 2 minutes more
Transfer chicken with its juices to a bowl
Heat remaining tablespoon olive oil in the same wok or pan used for chicken
Add carrots; cook and stir until just softened but still crunchy, about 3 minutes
Stir in bell pepper; cook until softened, about 1 minute
Add reserved chicken with its juices, remaining sauce, green onions, bean sprouts, and cilantro
Cook and stir until just heated, about 1 minute
Meanwhile place noodles in a large bowl and cover with hot water
Set aside until noodles are softened, about 5 minutes
Stir cooked noodles into vegetable mixture
